intro: Axyris sphaerosperma var. elatior, commonly known as the greater sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial herb with a sprawling growth habit, featuring woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in its native ecosystems, supporting local biodiversity.
